page.title: 01New Buckenham, Carleton Rode
page.content: The two villages of New Buckenham and Carlton Rode stand in a largely intensive arable countryside. An undulating or flat vista of sugar beet and cereals planted in large acreage between low hedge or bare ditch with scattered trees is interspersed with small hamlets. Here there is more foliage and some meadow land. New Buckenham, a tight knit village with still lively commerce, boasts a slowly increasing population, a rapidly renovating housing stock & completion of the new building infill. It lies to the west of its newly levelled recreation ground & large common. Carleton Rode contrasts, with its scattered residential development & lack of any businesses but 1 garage.
